Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hutchy68_9
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference and the organisers had booked an expensive hotel about 300m up the road at nearly doube the price. I found this hotel and it is ideal - just a couple of rooms on each floor - really nicely done - compact and bijoux and just 100m from the Champs Elysee - so central. Simple and basic breakfast to start the day - staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very well designed and comfortable right bank boutique hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: CalDreamn
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris regularly for work and have stayed in numerous hotels. The Monna Lisa has a very good location for the right bank, about two blocks off the Champs Elysees and one block from the metro (St Philippe du Roule station, although other stops are just a short further walk). The rooms are on the small side, however they are not uncomfortably small or an unusually small size for Paris. If you are travelling alone for business, the Monna Lisa is a very nice, well-priced option (less than EUR 200), and also I believe a couple would be happy in this hotel for one or two nights, especially if you are out sight-seeing a lot and do not need to spend a tremendous amount of time in your room. I would say that if you have a lot of luggage, want a bathtub or like to spend a lot of time in your hotel room, then this is probably not the hotel for you. If you want an American-style, larger room with two double/queen beds on the right bank then I suggest you look at the Hotel Sofitel Paris Arc de Triomphe, 3 Rue de l'Étoile, 75017. The refurbished rooms are clean and amazingly well designed to maximize the space. Coffee and tea are free in the lobby, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The lobby is furnished tastefully in a modern style (as are the rooms) with lots of chic art and photography books displayed about. My room rate included breakfast, which featured scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon, not just croissants. However, the breakfast does not have an abundant amount of choices, if this is important to you. Rooms are quiet and have free wifi, comfortable beds with nice pillows, speakers for your iPod/iPhone, a flat screen TV with quite a few channel choices (although CNN is the only 24 hour English-speaking one). Temperature controls were good. If you are over 6 ft tall the shower would probably feel cramped. All in all, a good value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “top location”
Reviews.Author: belgonur
Reviews.Content: TOP location very small room comfy bed very helpful staff the place dont look like a hotel from outside the bathroom wasNOT very clean 1min walk to metro stop if u get a good deal dont miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: me201037
Reviews.Content: Excellent location!! Hotel is very small, 4 rooms per floor. We had a deluxe room which was a nice size with a nice sized bathroom. Only thing was the bed. Very flat pillows and no duvet. Asked for extra pillows 2 nights in a row and hotel didn't have any!! Breakfast is super expensive and not worth the 22 euros for the quantity and quality. Very simple choices - croissants, cake, cereals and ham / cheese etc. Many restaurants around there which cost much less! However, we did get free coffee!! :-)) Internet / WiFi is NOT free as some booking sites state so be prepared to pay for it. No business center, but we already knew that when booking. All in all, it's a nice hotel, but very basic. If you're used to the high end hotels, then don't stay there because you'll be disappointed. Then again, when in Paris, you don't spend too much time in the room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Cosy, with great service.”
Reviews.Author: TheMonica
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with NikNac on their review. The rooms are certainly on the tiny size. I requested their best top floor room and was greeted with a room the size of my shoe closet back home. But what made up for the size of the room was the excellent service i got from the staff. I am embarrassed to admit that I really abused the concierge services, asking for everything from restaurant bookings to finding my favourite toothpaste in the city, but they always surprised me with getting it right. Thanks guys, will definitely be recommending you guys (PS: changing your old TV sets to wall mounted flatscreens will free up some extra space in the rooms!)

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and practical”
Reviews.Author: Happyogini
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cozy boutique hotel with a fantastic location and a great value, you have found it. We have read many reviews prior to our trip to Paris and chose this hotel solemnly based on reviews from Trip Advisor. The hotel is centrally located, about 25 minutes walk from the Louvre and a 15 minutes walk from Arc de Truomphe. There are two different train stations nearby on Champs Elysees, 5 minute walk, so the convenience is really unbeatable. Since we now live in Europe, to us the rooms are a normal size with a good sized and clean bathroom. The service was great, concierge was very helpful with all our questions and they spoke very good English. Lovely hotel and a wonderful experience, will definitely stay there again for our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A short stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikNak586
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Monna Lisa as part of a business trip. It’s an intimate hotel, with a small and easy to miss entrance. The staff are friendly and helpful, however the rooms are certainly on the small size – even for Paris. The TV only had 5 channels and the view looked onto an atrium and other guest’s bedrooms so you have to keep curtains closed. On a plus side a powerful shower was a welcome redeeming factor and the location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel, great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bubblepilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monna Lisa for 3 nights with my husband, 10 and 7 year old. We had a junior suite with two double beds (one a converted sofa bed) and balcony with opening doors. It is an exceptional hotel, the space and cleanliness of the hotel are among the best we have stayed in. The location is fantastic, steps from the Champs Elysee, close to chemist, mini-market (open all hours), great restaurants, two metro stations. With young children we wanted somewhere to stay that was close to sights (Arc de Trophie - great at night) and restaurants so we did not have to go on the Metro at night - this hotel was perfect. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and welcoming - they gave us advice on everything we requested. Always met us with a smile and took the time to speak to the children. Paris is a fantastic city to visit and the Monna Lisa Hotel and staff made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, quaint, confortable - in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Hampshireguy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on business and was recommended this hotel by one of my colleagues. I was upgraded to a suite, which was very comfortable and had a small balcony...great to open the doors for some fresh air. It's a small hotel but perfect location...literally steps from the Champs Ellysees. Great for business as I could walk to most of my client meetings. Limited services, but then again the location had everything at its doorstep (restaurants, small grocery next door, etc). It was very clean and the staff were very friendly. I would recommend it highly - great for a short weekend break or a few days of business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mcd05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monna Lisa for 3 nights. My wife and I plus our 7 year old son. The staff were fantastic - very helpful, great recos on where to eat etc. The room (I think a junior suite) was nicely appointed with a sofa bed for our son - a large a balcony as well. Very comfortable, well designed and clean. Location is very convenient - just off the Champs Elysees and 10 mins from L'Etoile. The restaurant was closed during our stay there (which we knew about before) but open for breakfast. Its a small, great, simple and stylish hotel - with nice rooms. All of the focus has gone on the rooms and the restaurant - the small reception area and the landings are unimpressive - BUT you're not spending any time there. If you are after a big hotel, with large lobby area and tons of facilities - then look elsewhere. Would definitely recommend. And ask for their recos on places to eat - we ate at a wonderful restaurant that we would never have otherwise found

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location,Amazing staff,Reasonable price and I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sarita1983
Reviews.Content: I just came from a trip to paris over the weekend and I stayed at Monna Lisa hotel for three nights.I must say that this hotel met all the requirements for me. 1- The Location was just perfect. right in the center ,everything was around..supermarkets,Salon,shops,stations. although it was my first time in Paris , I managed to come to the hotel by metro but the entrance was quite small and the hotel wasn't easy to find.Apart from that,although i wasn't familiar with paris, I used to come after midnight every night to the hotel because the area was safe and comfortable. 2- The hotel ,left and the room were quite small.The room and the bathroom were clean , super classic and simple ( i liked the colors of the room,Grey ,white, beige ,they made me feel relaxed.The cleaning routine was good.They don't remove your belongings from their place.The bad thing was that I asked for a street view and on Saturday night it was almost impossible to sleep due to the noise outside.. 3- The staff were incredibly helpful,kind and friendly.I must mention the Blonde young girl,the French tall guy and the ( Italian Marco) who for me was the best receptionist I have ever met..You can ask them directions or suggestions about anything..They are really GOOD. 4- I booked the hotel via internet and they gave me a special offer which was 60% less then the usual price,so I ended up paying almost nothing for three nights.Moreoever,when I asked to stay an extra night,they told me the room charge will remain the same.So Th extra night would cost as much as the other nights. After all, I may go back to Paris next month and I now know where shall I stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Small basic clean rooms-great location”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris and stayed 2 nights of our 4 nights stay in this hotel and then changed to another hotel. Rooms facing street can be very loud and we couldn't sleep well. Friends staying at rooms facing back yard had no problem and said that the rooms were quiet. This is mainly a restaurant with handful of rooms on top. The rooms are small, nicely decorated but very basic. Nothing extra can be found in these rooms. Basically they are great if you want to be right off the Champ Elysees and only sleep in your room. No mini bar. Small TV. This hotel is so small that it actually doesn't have a lobby or corridors. You come out of your room and there is the elevator and other 2 rooms doors! The location is great. In the middle of Champ Elysees buzz and close to bars and restaurants. If you want to hop into metro, its right there on Champ Elysees. We had dinner around the hotel and the pasta restaurant around the corner was really nice. The service is good if you can call it service. There is only one person sitting behind a desk that you can call concierge (remember there is no lobby). She and he were both really nice and as the hotel is so small they remember you and answer your questions with effort. I can't complain about the service as they always responded with a huge smile! We didn't try the breakfast as it was 19 Euros and not included in the hotel price. We preferred to go out and have a cafe au lait with croissants, which is also expensive in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, once you get over the shock of the size of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveller786
Reviews.Content: Paris is a beautiful city...we drove from Geneva to Paris in approx. 5 hours and looked forward to checking in at the Monna Lisa. First impressions were disappointing. There isn't a reception desk...for a supposed 4* hotel you would expect one. However there a small table with a welcoming smile. The various receptionists (we saw 4 in 2 days) were all EXTREMELY helpful, courteous and kind. They went beyond their receptionist duties. This is what really counted. After about 10 mins we were given our key cards and went up to our rooms on the 1st floor....TINY is the word I'd use to describe them. We had read someone's review about the 'super jet shower,'....There was a jet shower but the water just dribbled out. It wasn't all that! Once we got over the shock of the size of the rooms we wandered out to explore...The Champs Elysees is a mere 3 minute walk away - An ideal location. Once you get to the Champs Elysees you need to turn right and you can see the Arc de Triomphe (also the nearest metro station there)...about a 10 min walk. If you're there for the weekend, I'd recommend the red open top double decker buses than the metro. It's a 2 day pass and you can hop on, hop off. The buses run very frequently, but note the exact location of the bus stops. Overall summary, the Monna Lisa is more of a 2/3 star hotel with a 5 star service. The staff are extremely helpful, especially the breakfast staff, who go out of their way to cater for your every need. A quick note on the breakfast: fresh orange juice, a choice of hot drinks (capuccino, tea, hot choc), sweet croissants, buns, dried meat, cheese, cereal, fruit salad). If you want a real 4 star hotel don't stay here. If you want a comfortable bed for the night and want to be right in the centre of the city and get great advice/tips on sight seeing stay here. It's cheaper than other hotels in the area. Would I recommend the Monna Lisa? Yes, for the location. There are 4 bedrooms on one floor. The rooms are very small, especially the ones left of the elevator. The 2 rooms in front of the elevator are bigger. The room on the right of the elevator is a twin room and is okish in size. Would I stay again? Maybe if I got the bigger room. Would I pay an extra 30 Euro per night for a bigger hotel in a real 4 star? Yes Hope you found this helpful. At the end of the 2 days we had had a lovely time in Paris and due to the great smiling faces at the hotel forgot about the size of the room! Have fun in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but cute!”
Reviews.Author: arichter
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Monna Lisa. The location is very central and walking distance from the Champs E. While our room/bathroom were admittingly small, they had charme and good design. Breakfast/restaurant is small and stylish, rather like a bar. The staff was helpful and the place has a 'small hotel' rather family-run touch than feeling like a design temple. I would stay there again, however, if you look for a large room or have lots of luggage you might want to get a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Slick, but cozy rooms...”
Reviews.Author: citrusboy
Reviews.Content: The location you can't beat. With the prices of Paris' cool Hotels being astronomical, this hotel is a pretty decent value. The rooms are cozy, typical of a Paris Hotel. Excellent room design and quite possibly the best shower I have had in a room... EVER. It was one of those with jets on the side, and above. Must have been 6 or 8 jets and after a day of walking around Paris, This is exactly what you need! I would recommend if you aren't planning on kicking it in your room all day.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and discreet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the suites for a long weekend of romance with my gf and was not disappointed, room was spacious with a separate sitting area, balcony, large bathroom with a good shower and jacuzzi in a standard size bath. Queensize bed was very comfortable, and enjoyed peaceful sleep (even on the 1st night), perhaps it was the blown up picture of the Mona Lisa's hands above the bed that helped soothe me! The location was excellent, could see the Champs Elysee from the balcony and it was only a few minutes walk to the hustle and bustle. Booked the suite for €230 a night which in a city like Paris was a bargain. One thing I would say is that if you like room service, then this probably isn't for you, as the menu is limited to the menu of the rather good Italian restaurant attached.

Reviews.Title: “Would definatly recommend”
Reviews.Author: angela
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, tastefully decorated in a modern style, spotlessly clean, charming rather than luxurious. Our suite was more than big enough for a family and the children were welcomed by very friendly and helpful staff. The finer details made this hotel a special place to stay and we would definatly book again. The resturant was not open Easter weekend which would have been helpful with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Peas in a pod!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, in as much as it is just off the Champs Elysees, but the accomodation itself, in our experience, was far, far too small. We stayed in a 'classic double' room, which was absolutely tiny. With a double bed in the room the remaining floor space left you tip toeing around the bed and the size of the room the toilet was in has to be seen to be believed!! Overall it had a certain charm, but get a suite or leave I personally wouldn't bother!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hip small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Monna Lisa and it was wonderful. The location is fabulous--just off the Champs Elysees, the decor is modern minimalist cool, and the shower was awesome. The rooms and the hotel itself are small, but very clean and everything looks new. The standard rooms facing the interior of the hotel on lower floors can be kind of dark. The phone system needs improvement, as there is no voicemail and the hotel is not perfect about taking messages. But overall, it was a good deal and a very enjoyable place.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: katrineCPH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the classique junior suite at Monna Lisa for four days in July 2003 and we were sorry that we had to leave...The reception, restaurant, room and bathroom were just beautiful , the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is great, within walking distance of most of the sights and good restaurants and shopping areas. I can only recommend it, the only bad thing is that it is a bit expensive and now, having lived there, we won't even consider living anywhere else when in Paris!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Monna Lisa
HotelInfo.Address: 97, rue de La Boetie | 8th Arr, 75008 Paris, France
